articleTitle: Van Gerwen kassiert Abfuhr bei WM
articleTitleTranslated: Van Gerwen collects rebuff at WM
articleContent: Neben dem als Nummer acht gesetzten Chisnall erreichten auch Gary Anderson (SCO/13), Stephen Bunting (ENG/26) und Gerwyn Price (WAL/3) das Halbfinale.

Anderson, der mit Knieproblemen kÃ¤mpft und zur WM aus einer Corona-QuarantÃ¤ne kam, ging eigentlich eher als AuÃŸenseiter ins Turnier. Anderson spielt am Samstag gegen Chisnall. Vor coronabedingt leeren RÃ¤ngen im Alexandra Palace wird am Sonntagabend der neue Weltmeister ermittelt.
articleContentTranslated: In addition to Chisnall, who was seeded number eight, Gary Anderson (SCO / 13), Stephen Bunting (ENG / 26) and Gerwyn Price (WAL / 3) also reached the semifinals.
"Mighty Mike", as the Dutchman Van Gerwen is also called, lost 5-0 to the Englishman Chisnall on Friday evening and was left with nothing in the hunt for his fourth World Cup title, like last year.
Van Gerwen was behind from the start and was clearly dominated by â€œChizzyâ€, who is in the semi-finals for the first time.

ğ—–ğ—›ğ—œğ—­ğ—­ğ—¬ ğ—ªğ—›ğ—œğ—§ğ—˜ğ—ªğ—”ğ—¦ğ—›ğ—˜ğ—¦ ğ—©ğ—”ğ—¡ ğ—šğ—˜ğ—¥ğ—ªğ—˜ğ—¡ Dave Chisnall produces the biggest win of his career WHITEWASHING the world number one Michael van Gerwen 5-0 to reach the semi-finals of the William Hill World Darts Championship!

Simply sensational. pic.twitter.com/Lpv91X0sMcâ€” PDC Darts (@OfficialPDC) January 1st, 2021 Price defeats Gurney Previously, Gerwyn Price from Wales had reached the semi-finals. The former professional rugby player with the nickname "The Iceman" prevailed just 5: 4 against Northern Irishman Daryl Gurney.

After winning the crime thriller, Price will now face England's Stephen Bunting in the semi-finals on Saturday, who had defeated Krzysztof Ratajski from Poland 5-3 in the afternoon. Price can become number one in the world for the first time after the World Cup, but must also win his first World Cup title.

ğ—§ğ—›ğ—”ğ—§ ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—¦ğ—˜ğ—¡ğ—¦ğ—”ğ—§ğ—œğ—¢ğ—¡ğ—”ğ—Ÿ Gary Anderson goes T17-D20-D20 to take out a huge 131 finish to double his lead in the fifth set! Incredible ğŸ”¥ pic.twitter.com/EEG66s4fLzâ€” PDC Darts (@OfficialPDC) 1.

January 2021 Also in the semifinals is the Scottish veteran Gary Anderson. The 2015 and 2016 world champion, who had knocked Mensur Suljovic out of the tournament in the third round, finished off the Dutchman Dirk van Duijvenbode with 5: 1.

Anderson, who is struggling with knee problems and came out of a corona quarantine for the World Cup, actually went into the tournament as an outsider. Anderson plays against Chisnall on Saturday. The new world champion will be determined on Sunday evening in front of the empty stands in the Alexandra Palace due to corona.
